review: I got the fire stick as a gift from my sister. Originally she bought me the google chromecast.  I spent 6 hours that day trying to get the chromecast to work and dealing with the worst customer service I have encountered.So when i plugged in the fire stick i was weary... I it turned on, it connected to my internet, and was working in under a minute.If you are debating between google and amazon, go with amazon 100%. Its the easiest thing in the world. Google requires you to change settings on your router to work. ..but you don't need to with the fire stick.
author: Natalie K Stratton

review: Highly disappointed with Amazon and the Fire TV Stick.I have a Fire TV, several Roku devices, and a Chromecast in addition to this Fire TV Stick, and by far the Fire TV Stick performs the worst of the bunch.  Even when I am just in the menus, there is a noticeable lag not present with the other devices.  It feels like everything is delayed and slow, which is surprising considering the listed specs.  I don't have any buffering on the other devices, yet the Fire TV Stick buffers/freezes every few minutes during video playback.  This is all tested from the same location in the house and on the same TV.  I am pretty disappointed because my Fire TV works like a charm and the other devices with lesser specs work better.  I have a Roku LT that beats it hands down and it is several years old.Also, another frustrating limitation of the Amazon ecosystem is the 10 device limit on your Music account.  I can understand this limit 5-6 years ago, but now with more devices using this service, they really should consider raising this limitation or exclude Amazon devices from the total.
